notesStmt.note: Avraham ben Yosef ben Sa'adyah ben Avraham: inscribed with his name in the frontispiece and in the colophon, Sana, 1 Adar 1786 (folios 1v, 2r).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The Latter Prophets with Targum Onkelos and the Arabic translation of Isaiah by Sa'adyah Ga'on.

collation.p: Originally 31 quires of mostly 10 leaves as the catchwords and the quire numbering show. Collation has been modified at a later binding though.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script; Biblical text with Tiberian punctuation, Targum with Babylonian (superlinear) punctuation.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 13 December 1879 (folio 323r).
